author: ExpressDigest
title: Gwen Stefani says she is 'so excited' as she promotes upcoming New Year's Eve show at Wynn Las Vegas… two years after wrapping up her residency in Sin City | Express Digest
text: Gwen Stefani promoted her upcoming New Year’s Eve show in Las Vegas by sharing a post on her X account on Thursday. The 54-year-old hitmaker appeared to be particularly enthusiastic about her performance, which is set to take place at the Wynn Las Vegas. The No Doubt frontwoman, who recently opened up about living with dyslexia, also told her fans that she was ‘so excited 2 ring in 2024 with u.’ The show will see the performer returning to Sin City, where she formerly hosted her Gwen Stefani – Just a Girl residency. The Spiderwebs singer’s run of shows was held at the Zappos Theater, now known as the Bakkt Theater, at Planet Hollywood Las Vegas. Gwen Stefani promoted her upcoming New Year’s Eve show in Las Vegas by sharing a post on her X account on Thursday The songwriter kicked off her residency, which covered several eras of her career, with a performance on June 27, 2018. Stefani’s run of shows continued intermittently over the course of the next three years, and it was temporarily put on hold due to the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Grammy Award-winning songwriter’s residency eventually continued in October of 2021 following the lifting of several coronavirus-related restrictions on public performances. The Sunday Morning singer continued for another month before she concluded her run of shows with a performance on November 6, 2021. Although she appeared to be excited about her upcoming concert, the hitmaker will not be joined by her husband of two years, Blake Shelton. The 47-year-old country artist, whom Stefani met while serving as a judge on The Voice, will spend the holiday in Tennessee, where he is set to perform during the New Year’s Eve Live: Nashville’s Big Bash event. The singer spoke to Access Hollywood earlier this month and explained why she would be without her spouse on New Year’s Eve. ‘Well, it’s funny because I was going to be at his show, and then Vegas called and wanted me to be in Vegas,’ she said. The show will see the performer returning to Sin City, where she formerly hosted her Gwen Stefani – Just a Girl residency; she is seen in 2018 The songwriter kicked off her residency, which covered several eras of her career, with a performance on June 27, 2018; seen in 2018 Although she appeared to be excited about her upcoming concert, the hitmaker will not be joined by her husband of two years, Blake Shelton; seen in 2019 The 47-year-old country artist, whom Stefani met while serving as a judge on The Voice, will spend the holiday in Tennessee, where he is set to perform during the New Year’s Eve Live: Nashville’s Big Bash event; they are seen in 2016 The performer, who played two New Year’s Eve shows at the Venetian Resort last year, stated that, although she was initially unsure about taking another gig in Sin City, she eventually came around to the idea. She recalled: ‘Last year I did Vegas and I was like, “Remind me to never do Vegas again.” [But] you sometimes want to… not be the host. So I was like, “Eh, I’m gonna do it.”‘ Stefani then expressed that, as her husband was going to be playing a show, she felt as if she should do the same and give it her all for her fans. ‘If you’re gonna be working then I’m gonna be working — so I’m just gonna fly in and out. It’s gonna be awesome. I’m really looking forward to it,’ she stated. *** [Read more at DailyMail.co.uk](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-12907719/Gwen-Stefani-says-excited-promotes-upcoming-New-Years-Eve-Wynn-Las-Vegas-two-years-wrapping-residency-Sin-City.html?ns_mchannel=rss&ns_campaign=1490&ito=1490)

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Pooler Parkway North at I-16 shutdown due to accident with serious injuries
text:
Summary by Ground News According to a Facebook post, Pooler Parkway North at Inerstate 16 is currently shut down due to an accident with serious injuries. Traffic is being diverted onto I-16 East as First Responders tend to those involved and work to clear the scene. Pooler PD has confirmed one lane of travel has opened while the other remains closed. author: Oscar Maung-Haley
title: NASCAR star dismayed after being denied opportunity to 'honor' late wife
text:
NASCAR star dismayed after being denied opportunity to 'honor' late wife
NASCAR legend Mike Wallace has revealed his disappointment at not being able to compete at the Daytona 500 in memory of his wife.
Mike Wallace has been left perplexed by NASCAR's decision toexclude the legendary driver from competing at the Daytona 500 to honor his late wife Carla.
The 65-year-old had hoped he would be given the chance to qualify for the Daytona 500 for MBM Motorsports, only for NASCAR to deem Wallace, who wanted to race in memory of his late wife Carla who died from cancer last year in January, ineligible.
Wallace was excluded from racing due to not having raced on an intermediate or larger race track since 2015, despite having three career victories at Daytona International Speedway across three different series.
Should he wish to compete in the 2026 edition of the Daytona 500, he will need to run an intermediate track Xfinity race, an Xfinity superspeedway race and then a short track or road course Cup race which will allow Wallace to acclimatize to the Next Gen.
A disappointed Wallace told Sportsnaut: "I’m confused over how the process took place, how it was supposed to take place.
"I didn't know there was a process. Again, I don't want people to think I'm p

author: ActionNewsJax.com News Staff
title: Cold weather brings extended overnight services to those seeking shelter – Action News Jax
text: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. — City Rescue Mission (CRM) announced on Thursday that due to the forecasted low temperatures it will increase its overnight capacity as well as extend its hours to those in need of shelter. >>> STREAM ACTION NEWS JAX LIVE “We will not turn anyone away,” Paul Stasi, CRM Executive Director, said. “We want to make sure that those without a home have a warm shelter and a hot meal.” Beginning on Thur., Dec. 28. guest looking to get out of the cold for the evening can check into City Rescue Mission’s New Life Inn at 234 W. State St. in Jacksonville. Doors opened at 2:30 p.m. CRM said that all guests will receive a hot meal and will be offered access to showers and clean clothing. They are encouraging people to stay in for their safety during the cold weather. City Rescue Mission will keep its overnight services open “as long as the temperature is below 40 degrees.” SIGN UP: [Action News Jax Daily Headlines Newsletter ] Click here to download the free Action News Jax news and weather apps, click here to download the Action News Jax Now app for your smart TV and https://www.actionnewsjax.com/video/ to stream Action News Jax live.

organizations.name: city rescue mission’s new life inn

author: AB Newswire
title: Reolue Paves the Way for Hassle-Free Real Estate Transactions and Mortgage Solutions, Ushering in a New Phase for Homeowners and Financial Institutions | dailytimesleader.com | Serving West Point & Clay County Since 1867
text:
Discover Reolue's Unique Approach to Real Estate, Providing Struggling Homeowners and Others with Fast, Commission-Free Sales and Essential Mortgage Assistance Newark, NJ - Reolue.com, an emergent force in the real estate sector, has announced a groundbreaking service platform dedicated to transforming the traditional real estate transaction process. This innovative platform uniquely positions itself to assist homeowners, hedge funds, banks, credit unions, and mortgage servicing companies by facilitating direct real estate asset sales without the burden of commissions. This approach not only streamlines transactions but also represents a paradigm shift in the real estate industry.
Remarkably, Reolue.com has also committed to providing indispensable mortgage assistance to homeowners facing financial challenges. In an extraordinary move, the company has the capability to bring struggling homeowners' mortgage payments current, offering support up to $125,000. This initiative reflects Reolue.com's deep understanding of the pressure homeowners face and its dedication to offering tangible solutions.
Additionally, Reolue addresses the intricate issues surrounding probate in real estate. The company extends its expertise to assist homeowners navigating probate challenges with the courts, offering this service free of charge. This aspect of Reolue.com's offerings highlights its commitment to providing comprehensive support to its clients.
Relative to its efficiency and effectiveness, Reolue.com boasts an impressive track record of closing on home purchases within a remarkably short timeframe of 7 to 10 days. This rapid execution capability is a proof to Reolue's agility and its understanding of the urgency often associated with real estate transactions.
Over the past year, Reolue.com has successfully completed over 1,200 transactions. This impressive volume of deals highlights the platform's robustness and the trust it has cultivated within the real estate community.
Reolue services not only homeowners grappling with financial difficulties but also those seeking to sell their properties without the typical encumbrances of real estate agent fees. Focusing on the New Jersey market, Reolue is poised to make a significant impact, offering a unique and much-needed service.
Reolue's approach caters specifically to homeowners who require a swift sale process and those in financial distress, offering a glimmer of hope and practical solutions in challenging times.
About Reolue
Reolue has helped thousands of homeowners sell their home, regardless of circumstance.
They are experts at mortgage and home management, including foreclosure services, reverse mortgage services, real estate services, and borrower's services. Partner with a transparent company that does not wholesale homes and approaches each project with a unique mindset that keeps the best interest of the homeowner in mind.
